Package com.example.freeturilo.storage

Interface InternalConnection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StorageConnection
    public interface InternalConnection
    An internal file-based connection.

    Object of class implementing this interface performs low-level operations in an I/O connection model based on files.

    This interface should be treated as an adapter. It has been designed to support internal storage file connections but could also be used for other types of I/O file connections (it is used with project resource files for testing purposes). For feasibility of understanding the methods will be described as if they were methods used for internal storage connections.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    InternalConnection.Builder, StorageConnection, Context.openFileInput(java.lang.String), Context.openFileOutput(java.lang.String, int), File.exists()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkFileAbsent()
      Checks if the file of this connection is absent.
      java.io.InputStream openFileInput()
      Gets the input stream of this connection which can be later used to read content of the file of this connection.
      java.io.OutputStream openFileOutput()
      Gets the output stream of this connection which can be later used to write to the file of this connection.

    • Method Detail

      • openFileOutput

        java.io.OutputStream openFileOutput()
                             throws StorageException
        Gets the output stream of this connection which can be later used to write to the file of this connection.
        Returns:
        a writeable output stream
        Throws:
        StorageException - an exception representing an error which occurred when trying to retrieve the output stream

      • openFileInput

        java.io.InputStream openFileInput()
                           throws StorageException
        Gets the input stream of this connection which can be later used to read content of the file of this connection.
        Returns:
        a readable input stream
        Throws:
        StorageException - an exception representing an error which occurred when trying to retrieve the input stream

      • checkFileAbsent

        boolean checkFileAbsent()
        Checks if the file of this connection is absent.
        Returns:
        a boolean defining whether the specified file is absent
